member.summary: Gets or sets the name.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether observables are required in the view function.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.AutorunOptions.Scheduler
member.summary: Gets or sets the scheduler function to use. The function is async so that other code can be executed in the mean time.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.AutorunOptions.ErrorHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets error handler function that is called in case of an error. Otherwise the error is propagated.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.AutorunOptions.Context
member.summary: Gets or sets the context.

member.summary: Executes a function while specifying . The previous value of is automatically restored.
member.typeparam: The result type of the function.
member.param: The shared state to operate on.

member.returns: The return value of the function.

member.summary: Creates a reaction that operates on data of type T.
member.typeparam: The type the reaction operates on.
member.param: The expression that delivers a value.
The effect that is executed when the value changes.
The options to use for the reaction.
member.returns: An instance that can be used to stop the reaction.

member.name: T:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom
member.summary: Implements an Atom. Atoms can be used to signal Cortex.Net that some observable data source has been observed or changed. And Cortex.Net will signal the atom whenever it is used or no longer in use.

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.#ctor(Cortex.Net.ISharedState,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The shared state where this atom is created on.

member.name: E:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.BecomeObserved
member.summary: Event that will fire after the has become observed.

member.name: E:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.BecomeUnobserved
member.summary: Event that will fire after the observable has become unobserved.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.Observers
member.summary: Gets the Observers.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.IsPendingUnobservation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this atom is pending Unobservation.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.LastAccessedBy
member.summary: Gets or sets the Id of the derivation run that last accessed this observable. If this Id equals the of the current derivation the dependency is already established.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.IsBeingObserved
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the observable is being observed. An observable is being observed when at least one derivation actually accesses its value.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.LowestObserverState
member.summary: Gets or sets the lowest on any of it's observers.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.Name
member.summary: Gets the Name of the instance.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.SharedState
member.summary: Gets the Shared State of all the nodes in the dependency graph.

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.OnBecomeObserved
member.summary: Method that triggers event .

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.OnBecomeUnobserved
member.summary: Method that triggers event .

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.ReportChanged
member.summary: Invoke this method after this atom has changed to signal Cortex.Net that all its observers should invalidate.

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.ReportObserved
member.summary: Invoke this method to notify Cortex.Net that your atom has been used somehow.
member.returns: Returns true if there is currently a reactive context.

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.Atom.ToString
member.summary: Returns the name of this .

member.name: T:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1
member.summary: A node in the state dependency root that observes other nodes, and can be observed itself.
member.typeparam: The type of the computed value.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.derivation
member.summary: The derivation function to execute to get the value.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.setter
member.summary: The optional setter function which can serve as the inverse function of the computed value.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.scope
member.summary: The subject of the getter / setter.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.equalityComparer
member.summary: The equality comparer that is used.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.keepAlive
member.summary: A value indicating whether the computed value keeps calculating, even when it is not observed.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.requiresReaction
member.summary: Indicates whether this computedValue requires a reactive context.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.isComputing
member.summary: To check for evaluation cycles.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.isRunningSetter
member.summary: To check for setter cycles.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.value
member.summary: The computed value.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.lastException
member.summary: The last exception after accessing Value.

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.#ctor(Cortex.Net.ISharedState,Cortex.Net.ComputedValueOptions{`0})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The shared state this computedValue is connected to.
An instance that define the options for this computed value.

member.name: E:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.BecomeObserved
member.summary: Event that will fire after the has become observed.

member.name: E:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.BecomeUnobserved
member.summary: Event that will fire after the observable has become unobserved.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.Observers
member.summary: Gets the Observers.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.IsPendingUnobservation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this atom is pending Unobservation.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.LastAccessedBy
member.summary: Gets or sets the Id of the derivation run that last accessed this observable. If this Id equals the of the current derivation the dependency is already established.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.IsBeingObserved
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the observable is being observed. An observable is being observed when at least one derivation actually accesses its value.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.LowestObserverState
member.summary: Gets or sets the lowest on any of it's observers.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.Name
member.summary: Gets the Name of the instance.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.SharedState
member.summary: Gets the Shared State of all the nodes in the dependency graph.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.DependenciesState
member.summary: Gets or sets the state of the dependencies of this instance.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.RunId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the current run of a derivation. Each time the derivation is tracked this number is increased by one. This number is unique within the current shared state.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.Observing
member.summary: Gets a set of instances that are currently observed.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.NewObserving
member.summary: Gets a set of instances that have been hit during a new derivation run.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.IsTracing
member.summary: Gets or sets the trace mode of this Derivation.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.RequiresObservable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to warn if this derivation is required to visit at least one observable.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the underlying value.
member.exception: Thrown when a cycle in computation is detected or when an inner exception is thrown by one of the referenced observables.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.Cortex#Net#IComputedValue#Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value. Explicit implementation of .

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.OnBecomeObserved
member.summary: Method that triggers event .

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.OnBecomeUnobserved
member.summary: Method that triggers event .

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.OnBecomeStale
member.summary: Propagates confirmation of a possible change to all observers of this for delayed computation.

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.Suspend
member.summary: Suspends computation of this computed value when the last observer leaves. Computed values are automatically teared down when the last observer leaves. This process happens recursively, this computed might be the last observabe of another, etc.

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.TrackAndCompute
member.summary: Track computed value by calling the getter.

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.ComputeValue(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Computes a value.

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.Core.ComputedValue`1.WarnAboutUntrackedRead
member.summary: Warn about an untracked read of this computed value.

member.returns: A tuple containing the return value of the function or an Exception.

member.summary: Propagates confirmation of a change to all observers of this observable.

member.exception: When any of the arguments is null.
member.remarks: Called by ComputedValue when its dependency changed, but we don't wan't to immediately recompute.

member.name: T:Cortex.Net.Core.Reaction
member.summary: A reaction is an implementation that always run and does not have observers itself.
member.remarks:
Reactions are a special kind of derivations. Several things distinguishes them from normal reactive computations:
1) They will always run, not like derivations that only run when unobserved. This means that they are very suitable for triggering side effects like logging, updating the DOM and making network requests. 2) They are not observable themselves 3) They will always run after any 'normal' derivations 4) They are allowed to change the state and thereby triggering themselves again, as long as they make sure the state propagates to a stable state in a reasonable amount of iterations.
The state machine of a Reaction is as follows:
1) after creating, the reaction should be started by calling `runReaction` or by scheduling it(see also `autorun`) 2) the `onInvalidate` handler should somehow result in a call to `this.track(someFunction)` 3) all observables accessed in `someFunction` will be observed by this reaction. 4) as soon as some of the dependencies has changed the Reaction will be rescheduled for another run (after the current mutation or transaction). `isScheduled` will yield true once a dependency is stale and during this period. 5) `onInvalidate` will be called, and we are back at step 1.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.Core.Reaction.onInvalidate
member.summary: Handler that is executed when this reaction is invalidated.

member.summary: Indicaes whether tracking is running.

member.summary: Configuration parameters for an instance.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.CortexConfiguration.DisableErrorBoundaries
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to catch and rethrow exceptions. This is useful for inspecting the state of the stack when an exception occurs while debugging.
member.remarks: Enabling this setting makes it possible for the graph to be left in an inconsistent state. Do not enable this in production.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.CortexConfiguration.ObservableRequiresReaction
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to warn if observables are accessed outside a reactive context.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.CortexConfiguration.ReactionRequiresObservable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to warn if reactions are required to visit at least one observable.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.CortexConfiguration.ComputedRequiresReaction
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a instance requires a reactive context.

member.name: P:Cortex.Net.CortexConfiguration.MaxReactionIteractions
member.summary: Gets the Maximum number of reaction iterations that is allowed.

member.name: T:Cortex.Net.DerivationState
member.summary: The state of the instance.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.DerivationState.NotTracking
member.summary: Before being run or (outside batch and not being observed). at this point derivation is not holding any data about dependency tree

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.DerivationState.UpToDate
member.summary: No shallow dependency changed since last computation. We won't recalculate the derivation. This is what makes Cortex.Net fast.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.DerivationState.PossiblyStale
member.summary:
Some deep dependency has changed, but we don't know if a shallow dependency has changed. This will require to check first if this derivation is UpToDate or PossiblyStale. Currently only ComputedValue will propagate PossiblyStale.
Having this state is the second big optimization: We don't have to recompute on every dependency change, but only when it's necessary.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.DerivationState.Stale
member.summary: A shallow dependency has changed since last computation and the derivation will need to recompute when it's necessary next.

member.name: T:Cortex.Net.IAtom
member.summary: Interface that defines an Atom. Atoms can be used to signal Cortex.Net that some observable data source has been observed or changed. And Cortex.Net will signal the atom whenever it is used or no longer in use.

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.IAtom.ReportObserved
member.summary: Invoke this method to notify Cortex.Net that your atom has been used somehow.
member.returns: Returns true if there is currently a reactive context.

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.IAtom.ReportChanged
member.summary: Invoke this method after this atom has changed to signal Cortex.Net that all its observers should invalidate.

member.name: M:Cortex.Net.IComputedValue.Suspend
member.summary: Suspends computation of this computed value when the last observer leaves. Computed values are automatically teared down when the last observer leaves. This process happens recursively, this computed might be the last observabe of another, etc.
